User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

The blue tab insertion marker is buggy in a few cases.

1. Dragging a tab with no scrolling (right-most tab or tab from another window):
-The tab insertion marker will either appear touching the right side of the right-most tab or a few (about 10) pixels to the right, approaching the arrow that scrolls between tabs.  If I hold the tab over the area in question, the insertion marker will jitter between these locations.

2. Dragging a tab to the right as tabs auto scroll past:
-The tab insertion marker will either appear in one of the two locations I described above, or jump all the way to the right-most edge of the window, or sometimes somewhere in between.  The insertion marker should not move past the edge of the region that shows tabs-- it should not move on top of the scroll arrow or all the way to the right.

3,4. The same things will happen on the left side, like I described for the right side.

This only happens on the Mac version. The Windows version exhibits the correct (expected) behavior. I have not tested any Linux versions.


Reproducible: Always
